comment.author: 73313451@N00
comment._content:
Service Number 3051.

It looks like his full name was Edward Albert Newland, probably listed as Albert as his Father's name was Edward. probably of 7 Heigham Road, East Ham, London, enlisted in Handel Street. Looks like he may have been an apprentice engineer before he joined up.

Entered service 30 August 1915, leaving his parents and 6 siblings.

Served in Egypt Has the 15 star as well as the standard two.

He would have been 20 when he died at Thiepval. One of the missing of the Somme, his name appears on Pier and Face 16 B and 16 C. A terrible waste.
